thread.title: Adrian Peterson swallows chewing tobacco on flight: report
thread.title_full: Adrian Peterson swallows chewing tobacco on flight: report - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Adrian Peterson swallows chewing tobacco on flight: report
text:
Gregory Shamus/Getty Images Adrian Peterson was questionable for Sunday's game vs. the Broncos after reportedly swallowing chewing tobacco and getting sick on the team flight to Denver. This is a tough one to swallow.
Vikings running back Adrian Peterson is active Sunday despite being downgraded Saturday to questionable after coming down with an undisclosed illness.
That illness, according to the FOX broadcast, was because Peterson swallowed chewing tobacco on the team's flight to Detroit amid turbulence, and he vomited after the team landed.
Before the game, FOX reporter Jay Glazer said Peterson told teammates he was sick because of shellfish.
